title: $A higher as oil prices rally
text:
Tue, Aug 11, 2015, 9:07 AM AEST - Australia Markets open in 53 mins. $A higher as oil prices rally AAP â€“ 1 hour 16 minutes ago Recommend Print 
The Australian dollar has followed most commodity currencies higher after oil prices gained ground overnight. 
At 0700 AEST on Tuesday, the local unit was trading at 74.13 US cents, up from 73.90 cents on Monday. 
Oil prices ended a three-day losing streak as traders bought the commodity, thinking its price could not get any lower. 
Bank of New Zealand strategist Kymberly Martin said that gave commodity based currencies like the Australian dollar a boost. 
"In an evening of relatively little data-flow, a solid rebound in global oil prices in the early hours of this morning has helped boost oil-linked currencies," she said. 
"The move in the oil price appears assisted by data showing that Chinese imports of crude made a record monthly gain in July." 
On Tuesday, the National Australia Bank will release its influential business confidence survey and the ANZ-Roy Morgan weekly consumer confidence survey is also due out. 
CURRENCY SNAPSHOT AT 0700 AEST ON TUESDAY 
One Australian dollar buys: 
* 74.13 US cents, from 73.90 cents on MOnday 
* 92.39 Japanese yen, from 92.00 yen 
* 67.28 euro cents, from 67.41 euro cents 
* 111.99 New Zealand cents, from 112.03 NZ cents 
* 47.54 British pence, from 47.69 pence 
(*Currency closes taken at 1700 AEST previous local session) 
Source: IRESS
